subject: Re: [junit] failed setUp => manual clean up
msgSnippet: ... No, the default JUnit test runner doesn t do this. JUnit addons test runner does, however. See junit-addons.sourceforge.net. One question: what s the
messageBody:
thierryhenrio wrote:
> if setUp fails tearDown is not called
> if setUp acquire resources, and fails during one, cleanup code must be
> both called in setUp & tearDown
>
> wouldn't junit call tearDown event if setUp fails ?

No, the default JUnit test runner doesn't do this. JUnit addons' test
runner does, however. See junit-addons.sourceforge.net.

One question: what's the worst that happens in this case? Once the JVM
closes, are there any outside resources you end up leaking? If not, then
I wouldn't worry about calling tearDown(), because you need to fix the
problem anyway.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
